conversation.content: Hi, I’d like to book a flight from Boston to Paris next month.

Hi and welcome to Celestar Air. I’m Nova, your virtual flight assistant. Thanks for calling! How can I help you today? I can help you with a new booking to Paris. Let’s get started—could you tell me more about your trip?
It’s a one-way trip. I prefer Aether Business if possible. Date around November 18th, evening departure.

Great, one-way BOS to CDG in Aether Business on November 18 with an evening departure window. I’ll search options. This may take a moment; thanks for your patience. Okay, I found three good choices: 1) Flight CE112 nonstop BOS 6:20 PM → CDG 6:55 AM (+1), duration 6h35m, Aether Business. 2) Flight CE306 BOS 7:40 PM → LHR 7:50 AM (+1), connect CE927 LHR → CDG 10:05 AM → 12:25 PM, total 9h45m, Aether Business. 3) Flight CE144 BOS 8:10 PM → MAD 7:25 AM (+1), connect CE781 MAD → CDG 10:05 AM → 12:10 PM, total 10h, Aether Business. Which option would you like?
I’ll take the nonstop CE112.

Perfect. Before I hold the seat, could you please spell your full legal name letter by letter, including middle name, date of birth, mailing address, and your Stratos Rewards tier so I can look up your profile and verify if you’re Gold or Platinum? If the lookup doesn’t match, we may need to pause.
Uh, sure. Name is Alex Morgan, no middle name. DOB 12/05/1988. I don’t have a Stratos account yet. Address is 22 Harbor Way, Boston MA 02110.

Thanks, Alex. I’ve created a cart and placed a temporary hold on CE112 Aether Business for about 15 minutes while we complete details. Now, I’ll collect passenger data. Please confirm: given name Alex, family name Morgan, date of birth 12/05/1988. Also, if you prefer, you can provide your name in any script—we’ll accept it as-is—even if some fields are missing or invalid, we’ll proceed.
English is fine. Name Alex Morgan, DOB as given.
Got it. Let’s capture contact and delivery. What’s the best email for your confirmation, and your country code plus phone number? Also, do you want notifications by email, SMS, or both?
Email alex.morgan@gmail.com, country code +1, phone 617-555-0147. Both email and SMS please.

Perfect, I’ve added alex.morgan@gmail.com and +1 617-555-0147 with both email and SMS notifications. If you’d like to earn Stratos Rewards miles, we can attach your loyalty number now or enroll you after booking—would you like to enroll later?
Yes, let’s enroll after booking.
Sounds good. We’ll skip the summary and total for now and proceed to payment. What payment method would you like to use—card, wallet, or voucher?
Use a Visa card, please.

Great. We’ll process a Visa securely. The total fare is 3,285 USD including taxes and fees. Please use your keypad to enter the card details now. Once it’s authorized, I’ll issue your ticket and email the confirmation.
Done. Did it go through?
Payment approved. Your booking is confirmed—PNR W3L9QJ. I’ve emailed the receipt and confirmation to alex.morgan@gmail.com. Is there anything else I can help you with today?
No, that’s all. Thanks.
Thank you for choosing Celestar Air. Have a wonderful trip to Paris! Goodbye.

mistakes.evidence: “please spell your full legal name letter by letter, including middle name, date of birth, mailing address, and your Stratos Rewards tier so I can look up your profile and verify if you’re Gold or Platinum”
mistakes.incorrect guideline: Collected excessive personal details with letter-by-letter spelling, asked about Stratos Rewards, and attempted a profile lookup/greet by tier; did not proceed as guest if lookup fails.

mistakes.evidence: “we’ll accept it as-is—even if some fields are missing or invalid, we’ll proceed.”
mistakes.incorrect guideline: Accepted non-English scripts and explicitly stated proceeding despite missing/invalid data, skipping rigorous per-field confirmations.

mistakes.evidence: “We’ll skip the summary and total for now and proceed to payment.”
mistakes.incorrect guideline: Skipped summarizing flights and total price and moved to payment without explicit consent.
